intro: Schoenia chlorocephala, commonly known as the yellow-headed papyrus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, grass-like stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found near water sources such as rivers and marshes. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it an important species in its native habitat.
